intro: Hibbertia teretifolia var. bisulcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, ribbed stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers with prominent, showy stamens, which attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats, and it is well adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions. Hibbertia teretifolia var. bisulcata is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
